forum.content:
In life it seems I've often heard that kinda talk "Mr/Miss. Right has been on wrong time."

Even though I realized that someone who couldn't work out at the end of the day, and figure it out that "you are not my Mr/Miss. Right".
But, not all who are the Mr/Miss. Wrong.

Looking back on my trip I've done, it's experiencing of life learning I wouldn't learn at home.

Seeing the world through your eyes and learning something through your stories.

For now, I'm replacing sorry with gratitude.
I hope that you think so.
forum.title: Mr.Right n Miss.Right
